summary: A letter from attorney Jack A. Goldberger to the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding subpoenas issued to JEGE, Inc. and Hyperion Air, Inc., clarifying legal representation and coordinating with other attorneys. The document also includes an inventory of audiotapes and a breakdown of telephone calls, suggesting investigative monitoring.

events.title: Extended Subpoena Compliance Deadline
events.description: The deadline for compliance with the subpoenas issued to JEGE, Inc. and Hyperion Air, Inc. was extended to this date.

locations: One Clearlake Centre, Suite 1400, 250 Australian Avenue South West, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Subpoenas were issued to JEGE, Inc. and Hyperion Air, Inc., entities linked to Jeffrey Epstein, as part of a 2007 investigation.
Attorneys Jack A. Goldberger, Lilly Ann Sanchez, and Gerald B. Lefcourt were coordinating legal representation for these corporations regarding the subpoenas.
The document includes an inventory of audiotapes and a detailed breakdown of telephone calls, indicating law enforcement monitoring of communications.
The call log references calls to/from numbers associated with 'Epstein Residence' and other entities, suggesting surveillance of Epstein's network.
The compliance deadline for the subpoenas was extended to May 29, 2007, following coordination between the defense attorneys and the U.S. Attorney's Office.
